DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator that asks whether the patient has the ability to swallow oral medication.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a patient's swallowing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Swallowing; the act of passing something through the mouth and throat into the stomach.:A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment.

Concepts.definition: The act of passing something through the mouth and throat into the stomach.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a known ina
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known inability to swallow capsules?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to swallow tablets or capsules whole?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to swallow tablets?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to swallow capsules?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to swallow or keep down oral medications?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to swallow capsules or liquid?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any condition (e.g., gastrointestinal tract disease resulting in an inability to take oral medication or a requirement for IV alimentation, prior surgical procedures affecting absorption, or active peptic ulcer disease) that impairs their ability to swallow and retain dasatinib tablets?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to swallow oral medications?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable or unwilling to swallow pills?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to swallow pills?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to swallow orally administered medications?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to swallow and/or absorb oral medication (patients with a drainage peg are ineligible)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to swallow orally administered medications or has gastrointestinal disorders likely to interfere with absorption of the study medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to swallow oral medications or has gastrointestinal disease limiting absorption of oral agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an impaired GI function or GI disease that may significantly alter the absorption of oral IPdR and Capecitabine (e.g. ulcerative disease, uncontrolled nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, malabsorption syndrome, or small bowel resection)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able and willing to swallow pills?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to swallow orally administered medication or have gastrointestinal disorders likely to interfere with absorption of the study medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to swallow tablets whole?
